Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop, but I did have a couple of Problems
Reviews.Author: Alvin Bragg
Reviews.Content: Office Max just started to offer this model for about $650, which is very good for the features. It's fast and has an  i5 processer with 6 gigs of ram. The fingerprint reader is really neat. It has USB 3.0 connections which is nice if you have an external drive for backup that a USB 3 connection. The battery life seems very good although I haven't tried to see how long it really lasts. I like the "clean" look of the design. The aluminimun case seems to stay clean. There were some programs I didn't want,- but they were not hard remove. The speakers sound good, but are not particularly loud. (I have noticed that they have been getting a louder, as they are being used!) I was a little disappointed to find that Microsoft Mail no longer comes with computers. I would have used it, but g-mail or Mozilla Thunderbird work just fine. I tried windows Live Mail, but can live without it.UPDATE: After several months the computer would not shut down properly, so it had to be returned under warranty. HP fixed it without charge. After 11 months, it issued a little puff of smoke and stopped working. I returned it and again HP fixed it with no charge. After about 12 months the fingerprint reader stopped working. I did not try to return it again. I really like the computer performance, but have be a little disappointed with the breakdowns. I probably will buy another HP someday, but I will look at the Toshiba's too...

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Sean Parks
Reviews.Content: Really good product for the money. Totally worth it. Runs World of Warcraft very well and is responsive enough to finish my timed Exams.

Reviews.Title: A powerful student laptop
Reviews.Author: R. Byrne
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for around a week now, and it's been running very well. It's more than able to handle basic tasks like web browsing and word processing. Video playback speed as well as gaming performance (in Portal 1 and 2) is also excellent. The built-in fingerprint scanner makes logging in to my Windows account as well as my other online account very easy and secure. I would prefer Windows 7 Professional instead of Home Premium, however. The built-in webcam is somewhat below par with a high latency and underwhelming quality. But those are just small gripes that are easy to overcome. All in all, it's a great laptop

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It has been now 2 1/2 years since i've bought this laptop. Has never given me any problems even to this day.

Reviews.Title: Use it everyday.
Reviews.Author: CollegeStudent
Reviews.Content: My dad actually gifted this laptop for me (broke college student definitely needs one). As a college student, I need something dependable, and I am also a mom, so I need something tough. The hp pavillion dv6 works for me. Since I am on this thing atleast 5 days a week I wanted something easy to use. There are a few downfalls which I think others have mentioned. The first is the touchpad. The left/right click don't have any seperation at all (my other computer there was a small piece of plastic in between so you could tell which one you were using. Even after I have had it a year, I still notice myself right clicking when I want to left click or vice versa (nothing to upsetting though...just an annoyance.) The other thing I noticed is when I had a mishap with my screen. While it was closed, my three year old actually stood on it not realizing what he was doing which resulted in a crack. I left it alone for awhile because my computer was functional. Then I put my bookbag (containing my computer) on the back of door with a hook on it. When my bookbag slide off I heard a big thud. All of that is essentially my fault, but to repair it I bought a screen online (I was informed by the computer help store on campus they should ONLY be between 50-80, mine was about 55) and took it to the school to get it repaired which they did for free. Anytime I have gone in there and say I have an HP everyone groans. The word is that HP makes great computers but they are NOT meant to be taken apart. My whole computer had to be taken apart (about 20 screws and four different sizes) and once the computer repair man had my screen he said the screen was glued in. They told me usually computer companies will just screw them in, or maybe even have some clip or latch system. So they had to bring out a screwdriver looking tool that made plenty of noise ( making me very nervous) and pry off the glued on screen to install the new one. Then he had to put it back together. He also said in the fall there was a piece on the lower bottom enclosure (which is plastic instead of aluminum like the top of the computer) that broke. I could ignore it, but he said if it was his computer, he would replace it because it can sometimes put pressure on the LCD screen and cause the screen to break easier. I am grateful they were able to do those services for me, but HP's overall are just not made to be taken apart. Now I am searching online for a hardshell case, laptop bag, and a new lower back enclosure and am having trouble finding anything about this computer. There are a lot of products that are advertising for the gv6 6xxx series and not the 3xxx series so you have to be really careful because there is also a 1xxx and 2xxx series as well. Even though they are little snags I would say all around I do really enjoy my computer.

Reviews.Title: Poor networking, flimsy screen
Reviews.Author: S. Yelvington
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these (at OfficeMax) for my college-age daughter.The wi-fi sensitivity is so poor that we had to buy an external USB adaptor. TP-Link TL-WN822N 300 Mbps High Gain Wireless N USB Adapter with 2x 3dBi Antennas This fixed the problem, but it's a pain to have to carry around an external device to connect with the Internet.Last night she picked it up by placing her thumb on the screen -- something you wouldn't think would be dangerous in this age of tablets -- and the screen cracked.Clearly not satisfactory for a "portable" device. I've dragged my 11.6-inch Acer all over the world without worrying about it. I wouldn't want to take this HP laptop around the room.On the plus side, it was trivial to partition the disk and install Ubuntu Linux, so at least I don't have to worry about viruses ... if I can manage to replace the broken screen.

Reviews.Title: good laptop
Reviews.Author: dman
Reviews.Content: first off it is a good laptop for the normal person who doesnt do too much stuff, but i have had a problem with it and i missed the period to send it back but the only problem i have had with this laptop is that it will randomly freeze and i cant move the mouse or do anything on the screen and i will have to manually shut it down using the power button and when it comes back up i get the usual "it was shut down improperly would you like to start in safe mode" other than this problem it is a great laptop

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: Very good computer, came new, easy to use, good speed, excellent sound...... It is a good recomendation to anybody according with the price.

Reviews.Title: missing software
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Bought this laptop, but seller did not mention software was missing. Had to re install everything. It was a head ache. No one wants to buy a computer and sit for hours making user friendly after purchase

Intel Core i5 Processor 2.3GHz
6GB DDR3 (2 DIMM) RAM
750GB Hard Drive
